Package src.atm.account

Class SavingsAccount

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.atm.account.Account
      • src.atm.account.BankAccount
        • src.atm.account.SavingsAccount

  • public final class SavingsAccount
extends BankAccount
    This class contains additional functionality to have a bank account that applies interest to every transaction.

    This class cannot be inherited. This class inherits src.atm.account.BankAccount.
    Version:
    01/21/2018
    Author:
    Joshua Ciffer

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private double interestRate
      The interest rate that determines the amount of interest to be added on to any transactions.

    • Field Detail

      • PERCENTAGE

        private static final java.text.NumberFormat PERCENTAGE
        Formats numerical values to percentage values. Uses the pattern: 34.241 ==> 34.241%

      • interestRate

        private double interestRate
        The interest rate that determines the amount of interest to be added on to any transactions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SavingsAccount

        public SavingsAccount​(java.lang.String accountName,
                      Pin accountPin,
                      java.math.BigDecimal accountBalance,
                      double interestRate)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a new savings account. If all of the parameters are valid, the savings account is added to the account map. If any parameters are not valid, the account is removed from the account map and destroyed.
        Parameters:
        accountName - - The account holder's name.
        accountPin - - The account's PIN.
        accountBalance - - The account's starting balance.
        interestRate - - The account's interest rate to be applied to any transactions.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the account balance or interest rate is negative.

    • Method Detail

      • TO_PERCENTAGE_FORMAT

        public static java.lang.String TO_PERCENTAGE_FORMAT​(double percentage)
        Formats numerical percentage values to a formatted string. Example: 45.34 ==> 45.34%, 12.375 ==> 12.375%.
        Parameters:
        percentage - - The numerical percentage value to format.
        Returns:
        A string with a formatted percentage value.

        public double getInterest​(double amount)

        Parameters:
        amount - - The amount of the transaction.
        Returns:
        The amount of interest calculated for the transact
